Isn’t the inverse of subtraction, addition? Then why did he subtract 4 in the last equation rather than adding 4s? It would make b = 11
I still don't get it. I give up.

You totally still get the correct result if you do it in regular PEMDAS order, it just takes more steps and thus reverse makes solving more intuitive. But in normal order you would divide all terms by -1, leaving you with -4 + b = -7. Then you would add 4 to both sides, leaving you with b = -3. But since you didn't cover terms yet, I guess most people would be lost with my explanation
